intro: Isoschoenus flavus, commonly known as the yellow spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, yellowish flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Isoschoenus flavus typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological systems in its native environment.
